intro: Leurocline chazaliei, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 15-30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and it is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. Leurocline chazaliei is known for its ability to thrive in humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
